Title: Relates to directing the state liquor authority to require certain labeling of alcoholic beverages containing caffeine or other stimulants
Summary: Directs the state liquor authority to require certain labeling of alcoholic beverages containing caffeine or other stimulants; requires retail licensees for off-premises consumption to sell alcoholic beverages containing stimulants in an area of the licensed premises separate from that where other alcoholic beverages and energy drinks are sold.
ActClause: AN ACT to amend the alcoholic beverage control law, in relation to requiring the segregation of certain alcoholic beverages with a stimulant sold for off-premises consumption and the labeling of containers containing certain alcoholic beverages
